title: loudml cmd client crashes on "list-jobs"
body:
Just after begin trainning for 7 different models.

```
docker@worker3:~$ docker exec -it 5294608ad09b loudml
Connected to localhost:8077 version 1.6.0
Loud ML shell 1.6.3
> list-jobs
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/venv/bin/loudml", line 11, in <module>
    load_entry_point('loudml-python==1.6.3', 'console_scripts', 'loudml')()
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/loudml_py/cli.py", line 1446, in main
    loop.run_until_complete(main_loop(argv))
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/asyncio/base_events.py", line 587, in run_until_complete
    return future.result()
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/loudml_py/cli.py", line 1424, in main_loop
    await shell_args.exec(shell_args)
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/loudml_py/cli.py", line 366, in exec
    for line in format_jobs(jobs):
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/loudml_py/misc.py", line 318, in format_jobs
    eval_total = int(job['progress']['max_evals'])
TypeError: int() argument must be a string, a bytes-like object or a number, not 'NoneType'
```
